unit.description_uz: Bu bo'limda siz salomlashish, mamlakatlar, kasblar va shaxsiy ma'lumotlar haqida o'rganasiz.

vocabulary.definition: A greeting used when you meet someone
vocabulary.definition_uz: Biror kishi bilan uchrashganda aytilgan salomlashish so'zi
vocabulary.definition_simple: What you say when you meet someone

vocabulary.definition: An informal way to say hello
Something you say when you leave someone
Informal way to say goodbye
A greeting used in the morning

vocabulary.definition: A greeting used in the afternoon
vocabulary.definition_uz: Tushdan keyin salomlashish uchun ishlatilgan ibora
vocabulary.definition_simple: What you say in the afternoon

vocabulary.definition: A greeting used in the evening
vocabulary.definition_simple: What you say in the evening

vocabulary.definition: Something you say when leaving someone at night or before sleeping
vocabulary.definition_uz: Kechqurun xayrlashganda yoki uxlashdan oldin aytiladigan ibora
vocabulary.definition_simple: What you say at night before sleeping

vocabulary.definition: Polite expression used when meeting someone for the first time
vocabulary.definition_uz: Biror kishi bilan birinchi marta tanishganda aytiladigan xushmuomala ibora
vocabulary.definition_simple: Polite phrase when meeting someone new

example_sentences.sentence_en: Hello, I'm Aziza. Nice to meet you.

vocabulary.definition: Informal way to say goodbye, suggesting you'll meet again
vocabulary.definition_uz: Keyinroq yana ko'rishishni anglatuvchi xayrlashish iborasi

grammar.explanation_uz:
Ingliz tilida 'BE' fe'li (bo'lmoq) eng muhim fe'llardan biri. Bu darsda biz 'I' (men) va 'you' (siz/sen) olmoshlari bilan ishlatishni o'rganamiz.

**Qachon ishlatamiz:**
- O'zingiz haqingizda ma'lumot berish: I am a student (Men talabaman)
- Boshqa odamdan so'rash: Are you a teacher? (Siz o'qituvchimisiz?)
- Inkor qilish: I am not tired (Men charchaganim yo'q)
- Joyni bildirish: I am in Tashkent (Men Toshkentdaman)
- Holatni bildirish: I am happy (Men baxtliman)

**Eslatma:** BE fe'li o'zbekcha 'bo'lmoq' degan ma'noni bildiradi, lekin o'zbek tilidan farqli o'laroq, ingliz tilida har doim yoziladi!
grammar.explanation_simple: BE verb shows who or what someone is, or where they are

formulas.notes: I'm - qisqartirilgan shakl, gaplashishda ko'proq ishlatiladi
'am not' ni 'amn't' deb qisqartirish yo'q, faqat 'I'm not'

formulas.structure: You are not / You aren't / You're not + ...
formulas.notes: Ikki xil qisqartirish mumkin: aren't yoki 're not

usage_cases: Ism va kasb: I'm Ali. I'm a doctor.
Millat: I'm from Uzbekistan. You're from Russia.
Joy: I'm in Tashkent. You're at home.

tips.tip_uz: I bilan DOIM 'am' ishlatiladi, hech qachon 'is' yoki 'are' emas!
tips.tip_en: Always use 'am' with I, never 'is' or 'are'

tips.tip_uz: You bilan DOIM 'are' ishlatiladi, bir kishi yoki ko'p kishi farqi yo'q
tips.tip_en: Always use 'are' with you, singular or plural

tips.tip_uz: Qisqartirish (I'm, you're) gaplashishda ko'proq ishlatiladi, yozishda ikkala shakl ham to'g'ri
tips.tip_en: Contractions (I'm, you're) are more common in speaking

tips.tip_uz: Savolda fe'l (am/are) birinchi o'ringa chiqadi: Are you...? Am I...?
tips.tip_en: In questions, the verb comes first: Are you...? Am I...?

common_mistakes.explanation_uz: I bilan faqat 'am' ishlatiladi, 'are' emas. Shuningdek, kasb oldida 'a' artikli kerak.
Ingliz tilida savol uchun 'are' kerak, o'zbek tilidan farqli

practice_exercises.instructions_en: Fill in the blanks with am or are

questions.question: "Salom" so'zining rasmiy inglizcha shakli:
questions.explanation_uz: Hello - rasmiy salomlashish, Hi - rasmiy emas

questions.question: Kechqurun uxlashdan oldin nima deymiz?
questions.explanation_uz: Good night - uxlashdan oldin aytiladigan xayrlashish

questions.question: "Tanishganimdan xursandman" iborasining inglizchasi:
questions.explanation_uz: Nice to meet you - tanishganda aytiladigan ibora

questions.question: You ___ not late.
questions.explanation_uz: You are not = You're not = You aren't

grammar.title_en: Present Simple BE: he, she, it
grammar.explanation_uz:
Uchinchi shaxs (he/she/it) uchun BE fe'lining shakli 'is' bo'ladi.

**Qachon ishlatamiz:**
- Erkak haqida: He is a teacher (U o'qituvchi - erkak)
- Ayol haqida: She is a doctor (U shifokor - ayol)
- Buyum/Hayvon haqida: It is a book (Bu kitob)
- Millat/Mamlakat: He is Uzbek (U o'zbek)

**Eslatma:**
- He = U (erkak)
- She = U (ayol)
- It = U/Bu (buyum, hayvon, narsa)

O'zbek tilida 'U' bir so'z, lekin ingliz tilida erkak/ayol uchun turli so'zlar!
grammar.explanation_simple: Use 'is' with he, she, and it
usage_cases: Kasb: He's a teacher. It's a school.

tips.tip_uz: He/She/It bilan DOIM 'is' ishlatiladi, 'am' yoki 'are' emas!
tips.tip_en: Always use 'is' with he/she/it, never 'am' or 'are'

tips.tip_uz: He = erkak, She = ayol, It = narsa/hayvon
tips.tip_en: He = male, She = female, It = thing/animal

tips.tip_uz: Millatlar harf bilan boshlanadi: Uzbek, English, Russian

practice_exercises.instructions_en: Fill in the blanks with is or isn't

questions.question: "She isn't English" - bu to'g'ri inkor gap
He ___ from Turkey, he's from China.

vocabulary.definition: A person who teaches in a school

example_sentences.sentence_en: She's a teacher at a school in Tashkent.

vocabulary.definition: A person who treats sick people

example_sentences.sentence_en: He's a doctor at the hospital.

vocabulary.definition: A person who studies at a school or university

example_sentences.sentence_en: I'm a student at Tashkent University.

vocabulary.definition: A person who designs or builds machines, roads, bridges, etc.
A person who drives a vehicle

example_sentences.sentence_en: He's a taxi driver in Samarkand.

vocabulary.definition: A person who takes care of sick people in hospital
A person who controls or organizes a business

example_sentences.sentence_en: He's a manager at a bank.

vocabulary.definition: A man who serves food in a restaurant

example_sentences.sentence_en: He's a waiter at a restaurant.

vocabulary.definition: A person who prepares food

example_sentences.sentence_en: She's a cook at a hotel.

vocabulary.definition: A member of the police force

grammar.explanation_uz:
Ingliz tilida kasblar va narsalar oldida 'a' yoki 'an' artikli qo'yiladi.

**Qachon 'a' ishlatamiz:**
- Undosh tovush (consonant) bilan boshlanadigan so'zlar oldida
- Masalan: a teacher, a doctor, a book

**Qachon 'an' ishlatamiz:**
- Unli tovush (vowel: a, e, i, o, u) bilan boshlanadigan so'zlar oldida
- Masalan: an engineer, an apple, an orange

**Eslatma:** O'zbek tilida artikl yo'q, lekin ingliz tilida MAJBURIY!
grammar.explanation_simple: Use 'a' before consonant sounds, 'an' before vowel sounds

formulas.example_en: a teacher, a student, a book
formulas.notes: b, c, d, f, g... bilan boshlanadigan so'zlar

formulas.example_en: an engineer, an apple, an orange
formulas.notes: a, e, i, o, u bilan boshlanadigan so'zlar

formulas.example_en: I'm a teacher. / I'm an engineer.

usage_cases: Kasb: I'm a doctor. She's an engineer.
Narsa: This is a book. That's an apple.
Birinchi marta aytilganda: I have a car.

tips.tip_uz: TOVUSHGA qarang, HARFGA emas! Masalan: 'hour' - 'an hour' (h tovushi yo'q)
tips.tip_en: Look at SOUND, not LETTER! Example: 'an hour' (h is silent)

tips.tip_uz: Kasb aytganda DOIM a/an kerak: I'm a teacher (✓), I'm teacher (✗)
tips.tip_en: Always use a/an with jobs: I'm a teacher (✓), I'm teacher (✗)

tips.tip_uz: Ko'plik (plural) da a/an ishlatilmaydi: teachers, engineers
tips.tip_en: No a/an with plural: teachers, engineers

common_mistakes.wrong: I'm a student and a engineer
common_mistakes.correct: I'm a student and an engineer
common_mistakes.explanation_uz: Har bir so'z uchun alohida a/an

practice_exercises.instructions_en: Fill in the blanks with 'a' or 'an'

questions.question: To'g'ri gapni toping:
questions.explanation_uz: Kasb oldida 'a' kerak, teacher undosh tovush

questions.question: "I'm a doctor" - bu to'g'ri gap
questions.explanation_uz: doctor undosh tovush bilan boshlanadi, 'a' to'g'ri

questions.question: Qaysi biri xato?
questions.explanation_uz: She's doctor - xato, She's a doctor bo'lishi kerak

vocabulary.definition: What someone is called
A device for talking to someone far away
Electronic mail, messages sent by computer

example_sentences.sentence_en: My address is 25 Amir Temur Street, Tashkent.
example_sentences.sentence_uz: Mening manzilim Toshkent, Amir Temur ko'chasi, 25-uy.

vocabulary.definition: Parents, children, and relatives
Someone you like and know well
vocabulary.definition_uz: Do'st, yaxshi ko'rgan va tanigan odam

vocabulary.definition: An activity you enjoy doing in your free time
vocabulary.definition_uz: Sevimli mashg'ulot, bo'sh vaqtda qilish yoqadigan ish

vocabulary.definition: How old someone is

grammar.explanation_uz:
'Have' va 'Has' - egalik bildiruvchi fe'l (bor degan ma'noni anglatadi).

**Qachon 'have' ishlatamiz:**
- I, you, we, they bilan
- Masalan: I have a phone. / They have a car.

**Qachon 'has' ishlatamiz:**
- He, she, it bilan (uchinchi shaxs birlik)
- Masalan: He has a phone. / She has a car.

**Eslatma:** O'zbek tilida 'bor' bir so'z, ingliz tilida shaxsga qarab o'zgaradi!
usage_cases: Egalik: I have a phone. / He has a car.
Oila: I have a sister. / She has two brothers.
Narsalar: We have a house. / It has a garden.

tips.tip_uz: He/She/It bilan DOIM 'has' - boshqa hamma bilan 'have'
tips.tip_en: Always use 'has' with he/she/it, 'have' with everyone else

tips.tip_uz: Savolda 'has' yo'qoladi: Does he have? (NOT: Does he has?)
tips.tip_en: In questions, use 'have' not 'has': Does he have? (NOT: Does he has?)

tips.tip_uz: 'Have got' ham ishlatiladi (ayniqsa UK da): I've got a phone
tips.tip_en: 'Have got' is also common (especially UK): I've got a phone

questions.question: "She have a phone" - bu to'g'ri gap
questions.explanation_uz: Xato! She bilan 'has' kerak: She has a phone

questions.question: Qaysi biri xato?
questions.explanation_uz: He have - xato, He has bo'lishi kerak

questions.passage: Hello! My name is Jasur. I'm from Uzbekistan. I'm a student at Tashkent University. I'm 20 years old. I have a big family. My father is a doctor and my mother is a teacher. I have two brothers. We live in Tashkent.
questions.passage_uz: Salom! Mening ismim Jasur. Men o'zbekistonlikman. Men Toshkent universitetida talabaman. Men 20 yoshdaman. Mening katta oilam bor. Otam shifokor va onam o'qituvchi. Mening ikki akam bor. Biz Toshkentda yashaymiz.
